election_record.label: New York 1818 Sergeant at Arms

overview.note: There were two roll call votes taken to fill the post of Sergeant At Arms. The first roll call, on a motion that Thomas Donnelly be appointed Sergeant at Arms, was rejected 42 Yeas to 73 Nays. A Second resolution was made, appointing Caleb Benjamin Sergeant At Arms, was carried with a vote of 62 Yeas to 41 Nays.

election_record.reference: Journal of the New York Assembly, 1818. 6.
New York The Daily Advertiser (New York, NY). January 27, 1818.
The New-York Evening Post (New York, NY). January 30, 1818.
The New-York Columbian (New York, NY). February 3, 1818.
Orange County Patriot; or, the Spirit of Seventy-Six (Goshen, NY). February 3, 1818.
